description: man standing on table at R with many people in room surrounding him including musicians
inscription:
Inscription; Signature; Mark

Inscribed above doorway in pen and ink: [SILENSIVM]
markings: Watermark: large armorial with three crescents above [IMPERIAL]
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk
provenance: Charles Loeser, Florence (until 1922; gave to MIA)
signed: LR in pen and ink [Dom.o Tiepolo f.]
text: Nothing seemed to escape Domenico Tiepolo’s teasing in the comical drawings he made late in his career. Here he depicted a well-attended performance in the refectory of a monastery. An actor dressed as a Roman soldier takes the stage (a dining table) as an orchestra plays and spectators gather. Tiepolo took aim at the monks’ boisterous and distracted behavior—chatting, moving about, lifting furniture—during the recital, placing a sign reading SILENSIUM above the noisy scene.
title: A Recital in a Monastery
